body.p: The server can include an Oxygen AI Positron for Web Author plugin that provides the ability to use a specific AI engine for chat purposes or to run useful predefined actions. OpenAI, Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Claude, and Google Gemini are provided as default configuration options, but you can also connect to Google's Vertex AI Service by installing the Oxygen AI Positron Vertex AI Connector for Web Author or you can configure a custom service by installing the Oxygen AI Positron Custom Connector for Web Author.
You can download the plugin from here: Web Author AI Positron Plugin Download. The AI Positron is also currently accessible to try on our online demo website.
You can then install the plugin in Web Author to make the AI Positron side-pane accessible.

ul.li: If you are an integrator using the Web Author Component in your own solution, you need to contact us to discuss the plugin's availability and licensing.

li.p: The AI Positron side-pane appears in the UI only if it is properly licensed and configured by an administrator.

Optionally, you can configure a context and additional actions in the Preferences tab:
Actions

section.title: Custom Actions
section.p:
It is possible to create additional custom actions by defining them in a zipped JSON file and attaching it within the Administration page.
Create a JSON file that contains the custom actions based on information found in Oxygen AI Positron: Creating Custom Actions.
Zip the created file.
Go to the Administration Page and to the Preferences tab. In the Actions section, specify your zip file in the Additional actions option and use the Upload actions button to upload it. If a file has already been uploaded, it will be replaced with the new one.
Click Apply before exiting the Administration Page. Custom actions can also be distributed by being bundled with existing plugins or frameworks.

section.title: Tool Calls
section.p: Within the definition of custom actions, you can reference existing tools that are called by the AI engine to interact with the application. This gives actions more context information and generates more accurate responses from the AI.
The current available tool reference values are:

ul.li: get_current_document_text - Retrieves all plain text (e.g. without markup) from the current document open in the editor.

get_current_document_markup - Retrieves all text with markup from the current document open in the editor. An optional lineNumbering parameter allows the AI to request the returned content to include line numbers.
get_text_around_caret - Retrieves size-limited content around the current cursor location within the document open in the editor.
search_webhelp_content - Returns content from the associated Oxygen Feedback WebHelp system that a token has been configured for (in the Web Author AI Positron preferences administration page).
search_oxygen_feedback_site_content - Returns content from the specified Oxygen Feedback WebHelp system token passed as a parameter.
get_current_document_location - Retrieves the location (absolute path/URL) of the current file that is open in the editor.

li.p: get_document_content - Retrieves the entire content for a document with a specific URL. An optional lineNumbering parameter allows the AI to request the returned content to include line numbers.

ul.li: save_document - Saves the document at the specified path and writes content to it. If a resource already exists at the specified URL, the content of the document will be overridden with the new content.
edit_document - Performs exact string replacements in a specified file. The AI may prefer to use this lightweight tool to make a limited number of small exact changes in a document.
validate_content - Validates the specified URL and content and provides the collected validation problems.
validate_current_document - Validates the current opened document and provides the collected validation problems.
retrieve_ai_actions - Retrieves all defined AI actions (with IDs, descriptions) which can be invoked as sub-agents.
invoke_ai_action - Invokes a specific AI action ID with a specified content.

section.p: Also, in new chat sessions, the AI has access to content around the cursor location within the document open in the editor.

section.title: Extending Functionality Using Plugins
section.p: The Oxygen AI Positron plugin offers advanced options for developers to extend its functionality. Below is an overview of the main extension points available:

dlentry.dd: This extension point lets developers build a plugin that adds an AI connector to the Oxygen AI Positron. It enables connections with AI providers not covered by our built-in options.

To create a connector, follow these steps:
Add oxygen-ai-positron-api as a dependency in your plugin project.
Implement the ro.sync.exml.plugin.ai.AIConnectorsPluginExtension interface in your plugin's libraries.
In the plugin descriptor file, define the <extension> element that points to the implementation of your classes: <extension type="AIConnectors" class="my.pack.CustomAIConnectorsProviderPluginExtension"/>
A sample plugin is available to demonstrate how to add a connector to a custom AI service that exposes a REST API for OpenAI chat completions.

dd.note: The AIConnectors extension type can be implemented starting with version 27.1 of Oxygen XML Editor/Author.

dlentry.dd: The AI Tools extension point lets developers add their own custom callback tools or replace the built-in ones. This makes it possible to create custom interactions with AI engines.

To implement a tool, follow these steps:
Implement the ro.sync.exml.plugin.ai.AIFunctionsPluginExtension interface in your plugin's libraries.
In the plugin descriptor file, define the <extension> element that points to the implementation of your classes:<extension type="AIFunctions" class="my.pack.CustomAIFunctionsProviderPluginExtension"/>

dd.note: The AIFunctions extension point can be implemented starting with version 27.0 of Oxygen XML Editor/Author.

section.title: Distributing and Filtering AI Actions
section.p: When installed in Oxygen XML Editor/Author 27.1 or newer, plugins or frameworks can contain a folder named ai-positron-actions where custom AI actions are automatically loaded from by the AI Positron plugin.
The ai-positron-actions folder can contain an extra file named excluded-action-ids.txt, which can list all action IDs (on a line-by-line basis) that should be filtered out of the AI Positron UI.
